Governor Hassan Proposes Balanced Budget to Continue Building a More Innovative Economic Future http://t.co/Dvl80bY648
“I stand ready to work with any member of either party… so we can continue investing in critical priorities.”
“Over the last two years, we have proven that by working across party lines we can make significant progress.”
“There are additional investments that we may want to make… but the revenue isn’t there to responsibly do those things in this budget.”
“More efficient, more competitive and more successful economically.” (2/2)
“What we have done in this budget is make the strategic investments that we can afford to help make New Hampshire…” (1/2)
“And we must never forget how important it is to the lives of our people.” (2/2)
“The work that state government does must be done efficiently, thoughtfully and frugally…” (1/2)
“These are priorities that must be met…if we want to expand opportunity & build a more innovative economic future.”
“And we know that young people want affordable higher education & modern transportation options.”
“We know that our families are counting on safe communities, good schools & a high quality of life.”
“We know that the business community needs a skilled and healthy workforce, a solid transportation infrastructure & lower energy costs.”
“Allowing the department to fill positions & staff the new women’s prison.” (2/2)
“That is why this budget recognizes our responsibility to adequately fund the DOC…” (1/2)
“But to truly address the public safety needs of our state, we must also renew our focus on the corrections system.”
“But improving public safety must always be an ongoing effort.” (2/2)
“We should be proud that our state has long been recognized as one of the safest states in the nation…” (1/2)
“This budget uses those funds to expand efficiency and renewable energy projects.” (2/2)
“The RGGI and the REF are critical to encouraging energy efficiency & diversification through our growing clean energy sector.” (1/2)
“That is why this budget will allow DRED to develop a workforce recruitment strategy.” (3/3)
“But we also need to once again encourage more young people from other states to choose NH…” (2/3)
“We need to keep more of our young people here in NH…” (1/3)
“Our capital budget includes 4 million dollars for environmental & engineering assessment that this vital project requires to move forward.”
“Commuter rail will build on our many advantages and help set the stage for a new generation of economic growth.”
“We know that a modern, safe transportation infrastructure is critical to the success of our people and businesses.”
“This budget triples funding over the biennium to the Governor's Commission on Alcohol and Drug Abuse Prevention, Treatment, and Recovery.”
“Substance misuse also remains a serious public health and safety challenge facing our state."
“It will allow us to open 25 additional beds at the State Veterans Home.”
“Receive the full care & support that they deserve.” (2/2
“We must also continue our work to ensure that our veterans & their families, who have sacrificed bravely in defense of our freedoms…” (1/2)
“We must maintain our commitment to our bipartisan health care expansion plan.”
“This budget provides for the reauthorization of our expansion plan & includes the funds needed to cover NH’s share in the next biennium.”
“And states without it will see higher costs & find it harder to compete.” (2/2)
“Across the nation, more & more states are moving forward with health care expansion…” (1/2)
“In addition to a highly skilled workforce, we know that our businesses need a healthy workforce in order to grow and thrive.”
“The community colleges have indicated that with this increase, they will be able to lower in-state tuition again in 2016 & 2017.”
“And by 6.5 million dollars at our community colleges compared to Fiscal Year 2015.” (3/3)
“Increasing funding over the biennium by 13 million dollars at the university system…” (2/3)
“This budget builds on the important steps we’ve taken to begin holding down the cost of higher education…” (1/3)
“What I hear more than anything else from our businesses is the need for an even stronger workforce pipeline.”
“In order to improve efficiency & services for our citizens.” (2/2)
“Our budget recognizes the need to begin modernizing the structure of state government…” (1/2)
“This budget implements some of the recommendations of the Innovation Commission… creating the position of a Chief Operating Officer.”
“In my budget, I have been specific and transparent in what I have chosen to fund. The legislature should do the same.”
“While this budget is frugal, it keeps us moving forward.” (2/2)
“We must be frugal – that is who we are as Granite Staters – but we should not be penny-wise and pound-foolish…” (1/2)
“And that we too must adapt our approach to meet those needs.” (2/2)
“But we can still overcome our challenges, together, if we recognize that the needs of families and businesses are changing…” (1/2)
“I hope that we can continue to build on our bipartisan progress of the last two years.” (2/2)
“As we take the responsible actions needed to close out this budget in balance & look toward the future…” (1/2)
“Thanks to prudent management, combined with proposed legislation, we are in a position to finish Fiscal Year 2015 in the black.”
“This is a tight budget that reflects difficult choices.”
“But there are warning signs ahead: our population is aging and in-migration is slowing.” (2/2)
“Today, we stand at a critical juncture. We lead the nation in many measures, and our economic potential is strong…” (1/2)
“While also recognizing that we cannot afford to further erode the revenue sources that we have.” (2/2)
“And it is a budget that does not include a major new revenue source…” (1/2)
“It is a budget that is honest about how we will use our limited resources.”
“It is a budget that continues re-thinking and re-shaping how state government works to make us more effective and efficient.”
“Today, I present to you a fiscally responsible, balanced budget - with no income or sales tax.”

“…finding the solutions that nobody has thought of, the NH solutions that will help build a more prosperous future for all our people.”(2/2)
“What it will take, throughout our work together, is moving past the inevitable arguments, identifying our challenges and then…” (1/2)
“But as we embark on this next chapter, we must not be deterred, & we must not allow politics to stand in the way of our progress.” (2/2)
“Let us be clear; the challenges before us are great.” (1/2)
“Granite Staters are frugal and we pride ourselves on our small, nimble state government.”
“Each of the challenges that we must overcome to reach our full economic potential can be taken on while living within our means…”
“Our path forward must strengthen wages for our workers by restoring and increasing New Hampshire's minimum wage.”
“But we must innovate, negotiate, and get to solutions that lead to a stronger, more affordable energy future.”  (2/2)
“We will not capitulate to plans that aren’t right for New Hampshire.” (1/2)
“Working w/ local communities, we must find solutions while protecting our beautiful places, natural resources & character of our state.”
“In order for all our people & businesses to succeed, we must achieve the affordable energy future that has eluded our state for too long.”
“That our responsibility to our people, to our businesses, and to our economy cannot sunset.”  (2/2)
“As we plan for the future of health care in our state, we must do so with the commitment” (1/2)
“We must recognize that the benefits of our expansion plan are a critical component of our economic future.”
“…more than 30,000 Granite Staters [have received] coverage through our bipartisan health care expansion plan.”
“All Granite Staters must know they will always have the personal & financial security that comes w/ access to affordable health insurance.”
“Our business community understands the many benefits of commuter rail, and that is why they are calling on us to act.”
“…to spark economic growth for decades to come, we should bring commuter rail from Boston to Nashua and Manchester.”
“We are not going to move our state’s economy forward over the next decade by withdrawing into ourselves.”
“We must make sure that tuition at our universities is affordable enough to help attract & retain young people.” (2/2)
“In our next budget, we must work as hard as we can to continue to hold down the cost of higher education.” (1/2)
“Time to bring our standards into the 21st century to ensure that our students are prepared to compete for jobs in today’s global economy.”
“There is perhaps no area where the needs of our businesses and families intersect more than in education.”
“That’s why we will continue to balance our budget without a sales or an income tax.”  (2/2)
“Our low-tax environment will continue to be important to our economic success.” (1/2)
“We must not let ourselves believe that if we simply do things the same way we’ve always done them, the future will take care of itself.”
“With a relentless focus on ensuring that every Granite Stater who works hard can find success.” (2/2)
“To widen the doors of middle class opportunity, we must approach these next 2 years…” (1/2)
“Whether they’ll be able to make their mortgage payment at the end of the month.” (2/2)
“Our families are focused on whether they can afford to send their kids to college, and…” (1/2)
“We remain at the beginning of our work to ensure that all of our citizens are included in our shared success & prosperity.”
“Though the challenges before us are significant, we are capable of finding that new way forward, because that’s what Granite Staters do.”
“We must always be looking to find that place where differing ideas meet.” (2/2)
“To continue building an innovation economy for our future, with more opportunity for all of our people…” (1/2)
“And over the past two years, we have not allowed the partisan divide to be an obstacle to getting things done.” (2/2)
“The people of our state work through problems together every day, and they expect their elected leaders to do the same thing.” (1/2)
“It is an honor to serve as Gov & I will continue striving… to live up to your trust & to make progress for all of the people of NH.”
